website_summaries.verdict: Modern design in a Roman faucet with plenty of curves that you'll love.
pros: Offered in two different finishes of stainless or chrome
Spout is shorter and angles outward a little more than some others, which may fit better in your bathtub
Offered at a good price point
Both handles and faucet have curved shapes, so they match up well
cons: Need to order the rough-in parts separately, increasing the cost

customer_reviews.title: they were the least expensive delta Roman tub faucets I could find that I liked so that’s good and they were stupid easy to ...
customer_reviews.text: 5+ stars for customer service. 4 stars for this trim kit. Wasn’t sure this would fit my OLD spout and handles from 20ish years ago that we’re in the house we bought. Customer service was on point, able to tell me whether this would fit or not based on my description of my old spout. As far as the product itself, they were the least expensive delta Roman tub faucets I could find that I liked so that’s good and they were stupid easy to install. Only reason for the 4 instead of 5 stars is because they smudge very easily with fingerprints and are kind of a pain to clean up after.
customer_reviews.author: BAH8688

customer_reviews.title: This trim kit was a perfect fit for my existing Delta faucet.
customer_reviews.text: This made the finishing touches of the bathroom remodel quite easy. Went from chrome to brushed stainless. This trim kit was a perfect fit for my existing Delta faucet. For the record a trim kit consists of the bezels, handles and the spout, no valves.
customer_reviews.author: Average Homeowner

customer_reviews.title: Easy install but not insulated and easily damaged
customer_reviews.text: We were glad to come across this to replace our old brass handles and faucets without having to pull our whirlpool tub out. First one we got was dented and didn’t have a locking screw. Had to reorder and the new one had everything required to install. Runs great just be careful as it gets really hot when running hot water as it is not insulated in anyway. Otherwise pleased with the end result for resale.
customer_reviews.author: Magda

customer_reviews.title: Defective faucet
customer_reviews.text: This Faucet was defective out of the box. It was being installed by a licensed plumber. He called Delta directly over a month ago and they have not replaced the part. Now, since we unfortunately chose to go directly to Delta to attempt to get a replacement part the return window for Amazon has expired. This is absolutely terrible customer service on Delta's part and I would not ever buy another Delta product.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Sleek design
customer_reviews.text: Replacing our brass fixtures and looked high and low for something of good quality and affordable. Crazy how expensive Roman tub faucets are! Found this in Amazon warehouse deals at a reasonable price. Stuck with Delta brand because that's what we were replacing and apparently it's easier to replace with the same brand because otherwise you may have to replace the valve, too. The rest of our bathroom now has Moen sink faucets, Kohler towel holders, various brand light fixtures and knobs--all in brushed nickel--and they match fine. I suppose if you look REALLY close you would notice they aren't a perfect brushed nickel match. But with the various lighting in our bathroom you would never know.

customer_reviews.title: This was easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to install, once the separate Delta valve was installed. I love the flow of water out of the spout. It does not have an aerator, so the flow is soft and gentle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The brushed nickel finish looks fantastic. This was the cheapest of the four faucets ...
customer_reviews.text: This faucet gives you the classic but sophisticated looks without a bunch of curves or weird looking handles. The brushed nickel finish looks fantastic. This was the cheapest of the four faucets I looked at. I bought one I thought I would like better (Moen Eva), but ended up returning it because it did not fit the style in the bathroom. I couldn't be happier with this one and it was worth the money! You will need to buy the valve, which I purchased the R2707. The valve looks intimidating because it says you will have to solder the connections. Push to Connect fittings worked flawless on the valve and I didn't have to labor on sweating the pipes.
